intro: Dimorphanthera brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees, primarily in the genus Eucalyptus. It has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are typically white or pale green, arranged in clusters. The plant produces small, round berries that contain seeds coated in a sticky substance to aid in attachment to host plants. It is native to southeastern Australia and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree growth and providing food for various bird species.
